page.title: 18EMPLOYMENT IN FLEET IN 1985
page.content:
Although 1985 is a year of high {unemployment}nationally, Fleet is lucky in not being over affected. In June, the{Job Centre}had about 140 local vacancies and 805 registered unemployed. The main{vacancies}were to be found in Nursing Care, Engineering, Clerical Posts and Catering. Fleet's{Careers Office}opens twice a week to help 16-18 year olds find work. June is one of their busiest months with many recent school leavers so their registered number of 50 youngsters is above yearly average.
The{Youth Training Scheme}offers vocational paid training to this age group. During 1984/85 about 59 Fleet school leavers received training in Clerical work Catering, Agriculture, Manufacturing, Construction work or the Retail Trade.
